definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: I could feel the dog's thick fur when I petted him.
sentences.chinese: 我抚摸这条狗的时候，觉得它身上毛绒绒的。

sentences.english: Bright copper kettles and warm woolen mittens.
sentences.chinese: 亮闪闪的铜壶，手套毛绒绒。

sentences.english: Stewart: That cute, little, fuzzy wolf.
sentences.chinese: 那只可爱的，毛绒绒的小狼。

sentences.english: "Why is my hair so fluffy", thought Toby.
sentences.chinese: 托比心想，“为什么我的毛是毛绒绒的”。

sentences.english: I have a particular terror of fuzz appearing on my face, and always carry one lone item of beauty equipment: tweezers.
sentences.chinese: 我对脸上长有毛绒绒的物质有一种特殊的恐惧。

sentences.english: Pressing the furry critter's snout to his ear, he listens.
sentences.chinese: 他将这只毛绒绒生物的嘴巴贴向耳旁聆听著。
她毛绒绒的大尾巴摇摇。

sentences.english: In a patch of velvety moss, a black snake, called a racer, leaves her eggs.
sentences.chinese: 在一团毛绒绒的的苔藓里，美洲黑蛇产下了卵。

definition: fur/down (soft fur)/villi capillary (in the small intestine)
(pet name for a baby or small child)
variant of 肉乎乎[rou4 hu1 hu1]
